references.paper_title: Unconstrained dysfluency modeling for dysfluent speech transcription and detection
references.reason: This paper is cited as the foundation for the current work, proposing a novel approach to unconstrained dysfluency modeling.

references.paper_title: Towards hierarchical spoken language disfluency modeling
references.reason: This paper expands on previous work by exploring hierarchical models for dysfluency detection, which forms a core component of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Bigssl: Exploring the frontier of large-scale semi-supervised learning for automatic speech recognition
references.reason: This paper explores techniques for scaling speech recognition models, providing insights relevant to the scalability challenges in speech dysfluency modeling.

references.paper_title: Robust speech recognition via large-scale weak supervision
references.reason: This paper advances robust speech recognition, an area connected to the challenges addressed by the proposed model.
This paper introduces a novel approach to language understanding that integrates speech and language processing, providing a framework relevant to the proposed method.
